title: ORSEIS
content:
ORSEIS was the Naiad-nymph of spring of a town in the region of Hellas in Thessalia (northern Greece). She was
        the wife of Hellen, an early king of the Hellenes of northern Greece. He was the only son of Deukalion and
        Pyrrha, the two survivors of the Great Deluge. Hellen and Orseis' descendants would come to rule most of Greece.

DOROS, XOUTHOS, AIOLOS (by Hellen) (Apollodorus 1.49)

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 1. 49 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "Hellen and a Nymphe named Orseis had Doros (Dorus), Xouthos (Xuthus), and Aiolos (Aeolus)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
